featured.text: Requirements for a 14-day non-visa entry are: passport good for at least six months, confirmed onward ticket within 14 days, no violation of law recorded.
It was at this time that passports as we would recognize them today began to be used.
King Henry V of England is credited with having invented the first true passport, as a way of helping his subjects prove who they were in foreign lands.
Later, in the medieval Islamic Caliphate, a form of passport was the bara’a, a receipt for taxes paid.
Nevertheless, passports were not generally required for international travel until the First World War.

other.text: The earliest reference to these documents is found in a 15th-century Act of Parliament, while the term “passport” came into use about a century later.
Which of the following is NOT mentioned in the passage as a form of passport? (A) A letter.
But the earliest mention of an object which we might recognize as a passport appeared in about 450 B.C.
A passport that is valid for more than six months.
When did the term “passport” start being used?
to apply for a visa before leaving the U.S.A. (C) to make sure her passport was issued before May 1, 1995.

definition.zh_def: 護照：由政府發放的證件，證明持有者的國籍和身份，通常用於國際旅行。
definition.en_def: A passport is an official document issued by a government that certifies a person's identity and nationality, typically used for international travel.
definition.example: I need to renew my passport before my trip to Europe.
